fields.headline: They have news for you ...
fields.bodyText: Katie Couric Anchor of America's CBS Evening News earns around $15million a year. She says: When US petrol reached $2.94 a gallon, 'I had to take out a loan to fill up my minivan. It's crazy.' They say: 'A woman pushing 50 coming into your living room at 7am dressed in an age-inappropriate manner saying, "I can't imagine paying $100 for a skirt", with what she earns, doesn't sit well.' Sir Trevor Mcdonald Formerly the highest-paid newsreader in the UK, earning £600,000 a year from ITV News. Liked for: His straightforward, no-nonsense style. Career low: Babbling 'unintelligible nonsense' at footage of a plane waiting for Beirut hostage John McCarthy to arrive back in Britain. Then missing the moment because of a commercial break. Anna Ford Joined ITN in 1978 as its first female newsreader for £14,000 a year. Left the BBC last April. Watch your back: Michael Buerk. Ford referred to him as an 'old-fashioned chauvinist of the first order' and 'a poor, miserable old bat' after he'd whinged about women in broadcasting. Temperament: Erratic. Pushed Robin Day into a bush and threw wine over Jonathan Aitken. Mary Nightingale Earns £300,000 from ITV's Evening News. She says: 'It is a job that's easy to do badly and one that looks easy when you're doing it well.' They say: 'She's hot property.' Natasha Kaplinsky Earns £175,000 as co-presenter of BBC1's Six O'Clock News Some like it hot: Caused a commotion on Strictly Come Dancing. Private Eye called her 'ratings Viagra'. Ground swallow-me-up: Suggested to Joan Collins that Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat would make a great musical. Huw Edwards Replaced 'old bat' Buerk on BBC1's Ten O'Clock News. Earns £250,000. Accused of: Deliberately inserting pauses between syllables in order to sound more Welsh. Kirsty Young The face of Five News and, at £500,000, the highest-paid newsreader in the UK. Critical acclaim: For guest-presenting Have I Got News For You in 2003. The future holds: Replacing Sue Lawley on Radio 4's Desert Island Discs Jon Snow Earns £350,000 as Channel 4 News frontman. Respect: Reports from disaster spots the world over. Strange but true: MI6 once tried to tempt him with a job offer but he turned them down. Apparently ...
